summary: An FBI FD-1023 form documenting a Confidential Human Source's (CHS) reporting on alleged foreign influence operations targeting U.S. officials and the electoral process. The report makes wide-ranging claims connecting Jeffrey Epstein, Alan Dershowitz, the Kushner family, and others to intelligence services (Mossad, Russia) and corrupt financial dealings. It urges the FBI to investigate various individuals and entities for corruption, money laundering, and unregistered lobbying.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.role: Harvard Law Professor, Attorney for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Reportedly influenced students from wealthy families like the Kushners; claimed by the CHS to have been co-opted by Mossad; represented Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Josh Kushner
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the wealthy students influenced by Alan Dershowitz.

persons.name: Jared Kushner
persons.role: Student of Alan Dershowitz, Senior Advisor to President Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as a student of Dershowitz; alleged by the CHS to be the 'real brains' behind Trump's organization; accused of moving Russian investment money and not disclosing stakes in Cadre due to Russian ties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Accused sex trafficker, alleged intelligence asset
persons.context: Described as being represented by Alan Dershowitz and claimed by Dershowitz to belong to U.S. and allied intelligence services; alleged to have been a co-opted Mossad agent trained under Ehud Barak.

persons.name: Alex Ocasta
persons.role: U.S. Attorney of Southern District of Florida (at the time)
persons.context: Was allegedly told by Alan Dershowitz that Jeffrey Epstein belonged to U.S. and allied intelligence services.

persons.name: Ehud Barak
persons.context: Described as close to Jeffrey Epstein and as the person under whom Epstein was trained as a spy.

persons.name: Masha Drokova
persons.role: Founder of Day One Ventures, former Putin contact
persons.context: Based in Silicon Valley; formerly Putin's main contact in the Russian Youth movement; told the CHS Epstein was a 'wonderful man'; CHS concluded her venture was to steal technology.

persons.name: Ivanka Trump
persons.role: Daughter of and advisor to President Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as being at Rabbi Scheersom's gravesite with Jared Kushner on the day Trump was elected president.

persons.name: Charles Kushner
persons.role: Father of Jared Kushner, real estate developer
persons.context: Highlighted in an attached article for deep ties to Israel and history of corrupt business practices; was introduced to Chinese Ambassador Cui Tiankai by Henry Kissinger.

persons.name: Ken Kurson
persons.context: Identified by the CHS as someone who 'knows everything' about the Kushners' relationships with the Middle East.

persons.name: Henry Kissinger
persons.context: Reportedly introduced Charles Kushner to Chinese Ambassador Cui Tiankai.

persons.name: Cui Tiankai
persons.context: Was introduced to Charles Kushner by Henry Kissinger, a relationship potentially helpful during Anbang's negotiations over 666 Fifth Avenue.

persons.name: Hary Tanoesoedinbjo
persons.role: Indonesian billionaire, business associate of Trump
persons.context: Involved in developing Trump's hotels; allegedly bought his Beverly Hills home from Trump at an inflated price; hosted Trump who said he would 'fuck Amazon' over military contracts.

persons.name: Igor Korbatov
persons.context: Brokered the sale of a Beverly Hills mansion to Trump for $800,000 less than market value, a deal described as having numerous oddities.

persons.name: Ross Delston
persons.role: Attorney and consultant on financial crimes
persons.context: Commentator cited in an attached article, stating the Trump mansion deal had 'many facets that don't add up' and warranted further scrutiny.

persons.name: Lisa Korbatov
persons.role: Wife of Igor Korbatov, GOP activist, school board president
persons.context: Daughter of the Fisches; an active member of the Beverly Hills Jewish community; GOP activist.

persons.name: Michael Cohen
persons.context: Filed legal papers for the shell company involved in Trump's Beverly Hills mansion purchase and notarized the deed when Trump sold it.

persons.name: Renda Tillerson
persons.context: Told the CHS about smears in the New York Post and that Jared Kushner was running a rival State Department operation; claimed she and her husband were under intense surveillance.

persons.name: Rex Tillerson
persons.context: Affirmed his wife Renda's claims about Jared Kushner running a rival State Department operation and being under surveillance.

persons.name: Daren Blanton
persons.context: Introduced Renda Tillerson to the CHS.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.role: CEO of Apollo, owner of Constellis (formerly Blackwater)
persons.context: Reportedly stood by Jeffrey Epstein, giving him $50M; Apollo lent the Kushners $184 million; owns mercenary firm accused of arms and human trafficking scandals.

persons.name: Elliott Broidy
persons.context: Pleaded to charges related to money laundering and unregistered lobbying for the UAE; allegedly lobbied to increase sanctions on Qatar; was a major fundraiser for Trump.

persons.name: Joel Mowbray
persons.role: Associate of Elliott Broidy, alleged unregistered lobbyist
persons.context: Described as being in Broidy's inner circle, 'shifty,' a convert to Judaism, and someone who would 'flip' on Broidy.

persons.name: Ed Royce
persons.context: Described as close to Elliott Broidy and trying to do 'shady things'; his wife may be a lobbyist who works with Broidy.

persons.name: Matt Melen
persons.context: Told the CHS that after Gawker was destroyed, Russian Intelligence Service started using Zero Hedge to influence U.S. people.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in contexts of being compromised by Israel, making comments about Amazon at Hary Tanoesoedinbjo's house, and in real estate transactions.

connections.description: Dershowitz was a professor to Jared Kushner at Harvard Law.
Epstein was described as close to Barak and trained as a spy under him.
Kissinger introduced Charles Kushner to Chinese Ambassador Cui Tiankai.
Black reportedly gave Epstein $50 million and stood by him.
Apollo, led by Black, lent the Kushners $184 million.
Mowbray was in Broidy's inner circle, described as an unregistered lobbyist.
Royce was described as close to Broidy.
Renda and Rex Tillerson claimed Jared Kushner was running a rival State Department operation.
Hary developed Trump's hotels and bought a Beverly Hills home from him.

events.title: CHS Contact via Encrypted App
events.description: The Confidential Human Source had contact with the FBI handling agent via an encrypted messaging app, providing expanded information on foreign influence.

events.title: Publication of Kushner Article
events.description: Publication of the article 'Jim McGreevey and His Main Man' highlighting Charles Kushner's ties to Israel and alleged corrupt practices.

events.title: Publication of Trump Mansion Article
events.description: Publication of the article 'A small-time scam artist gave Trump a mansion for $0. Why?' investigating the oddities of Trump's Beverly Hills real estate transaction.

events.title: FBI Report Filed
events.description: The FD-1023 form documenting the CHS's allegations was submitted and approved.

locations: Silicon Valley (Location of Day One Ventures)
Beverly Hills, California (Site of Trump mansion transaction)
keyFacts: The CHS alleges that Alan Dershowitz told a U.S. Attorney that Jeffrey Epstein 'belonged to both U.S. and allied intelligence services' and that Epstein was a co-opted Mossad agent trained under former Israeli PM Ehud Barak.

The CHS claims that Jared Kushner is the 'real brains' behind Trump's organization and presidency, and that he has moved a lot of Russian investment money, suggesting the FBI investigate Kushner family charities for corruption and money laundering.
The report alleges that Masha Drokova, a former Putin contact running a Silicon Valley venture fund, praised Epstein as a 'wonderful man' and that her firm's purpose was to steal technology.

The CHS urges investigation into several financial dealings, including Leon Black's $50M gift to Epstein, Apollo's $184M loan to the Kushners, and the oddities surrounding Trump's purchase and sale of a Beverly Hills mansion.

The document frames a narrative of foreign influence on U.S. politics by Israel, Russia, and the UAE, involving alleged intelligence assets (Epstein), lobbying (Broidy), and financial corruption (Kushners).
